qas.question: How many proposals were available in 1991?
Other than ASPEC what was another proposal?
The Musicam format was proposed by Philips, based in which country?
Which other quality alongside simplicty was key in selecting this proposal?
What was the Musican format based on?

context: In 1991, there were only <a0_0>two<a0_0/> proposals available that could be completely assessed for an MPEG audio standard: <a1_0>Musicam<a1_0/> (Masking pattern adapted Universal Subband Integrated Coding And Multiplexing) and ASPEC (Adaptive Spectral Perceptual Entropy Coding). The Musicam technique, as proposed by Philips (the <a2_0>Netherlands<a2_0/>), CCETT (France) and Institut für Rundfunktechnik (Germany) was chosen due to its simplicity and <a3_0>error robustness<a3_0/>, as well as its low computational power associated with the encoding of high quality compressed audio. The Musicam format, based on <a4_0>sub-band coding<a4_0/>, was the basis of the MPEG Audio compression format (sampling rates, structure of frames, headers, number of samples per frame).
